author: Mirage News
title: Weather plays nice as recovery gets into full swing | Mirage News
text: Ten days after Mother Nature turned nasty, the City of Logan today finally got the upper-hand. The post-Christmas period produced a tornado, storms, a heatwave and flooding that tested the resolve of thousands of local residents, business owners and primary producers. But under sunny skies today, Logan City Council clean-up crews and community support officers steered an expanded multi-agency phase to the recovery operation. In addition to providing ongoing support and assistance to hundreds of residents through two Community Recovery Hubs, further inroads were made in removing fallen vegetation, clearing roads and opening other access points in the hardest-hit suburbs including Cedar Grove, Mundoolun, Cedar Vale, Jimboomba and Greenbank. On the ground with Council today as part of the multi-agency recovery were: - A contingent from the Australian Defence Force (ADF) tasked with assisting in the restoration of critical infrastructure. - Energex crews working towards having power restored to most local properties by Sunday (January 7). As of noon today (Thursday, January 4), 1575 properties in Logan were still without power. - Chainsaw experts processing tree trunks and branches into pieces that can be easily removed. - The State Emergency Service responded to 10 callouts in the last 24 hours, down from more than 100 the previous day. Anyone needing SES assistance should call 132 500. If the situation is life-threatening, call 000. - A team from not-for-profit Disaster Relief Australia (DRA) will arrive tomorrow (Friday, January 5). The crew will initially assist in the roads clean-up. DRA staff include veterans, retired first responders and other volunteers. The Mayor visited Cedar Grove today to observe the work being done by the ADF. "There's a lot of support for the ADF in the community - it's a morale boost because residents out this way have been through so much over the holiday period when many others were celebrating," he said. "They can see there are a lot more hands working on getting things done which is terrific." From tomorrow (Friday, January 5), Council's Local Recovery Group (LRG) will take the Logan lead following on from the disaster response effort of the last 10 days. In addition to driving the ongoing clean-up, the LRG will also aim to ensure impacted residents, businesses and farmers are aware of all available hardship funding and support and Council infrastructure and services are fully restored as soon as possible. As at noon on Thursday, January 4, key information for the community included: - More than 600 meals were served at the Community Recovery Hub at Jimboomba yesterday, up from around 400 the previous day. Hot showers and free laundry services ran all day. The hub, located in the Jimboomba Library and Community Centre on Honora St, provides a place for residents to engage with Community Recovery staff, receive referrals for community and government agencies, apply for hardship grants and receive insurance information. Support for residents impacted by storms, blackouts or flooding is available through the Community Recovery Hotline - 1800 173 349 - or online at www.qld.gov.au - More than 70 people attended the first morning of a new pop-up Community Recovery Hub at Cedar Grove, with a number accessing the free hot showers. The support service, operating out of the Landcare Environmental Centre, 441 Cedar Grove Rd, from 9am-4pm will operate through to Sunday, January 7. - Kerbside cleanup will begin on Monday (January 8) as planned for six suburbs in the southwest. But collections will be done in a sequence that leaves the hardest-hit suburbs until last. This will allow Council crews to clear vegetation from footpaths and will ensure Cleanaway trucks do not hinder the current clean-up. The latter suburbs may not be serviced until the week beginning January 15. The order is: Park Ridge South; New Beith; North McLean; South McLean; Greenbank; Munruben. [here](/weather-plays-nice-as-recovery-gets-into-full-1151585/).

author: Devdiscourse News Desk
title: Drama Unfolds in Asia's Third Round of World Cup Qualifying | Sports-Games
text: Drama Unfolds in Asia's Third Round of World Cup Qualifying An exciting start to Asia's third round of World Cup qualifying saw Bahrain stun Australia 1-0, while Japan thrashed China 7-0, and Saudi Arabia and South Korea were held to unexpected draws. The battle continues as countries vie for a spot in the 2026 World Cup finals in the US, Mexico, and Canada. [Devdiscourse News Desk](/devdiscourse-stories)| Updated: 06-09-2024 02:42 IST | Created: 06-09-2024 02:42 IST Asia's third round of World Cup qualifying kicked off with unexpected results, the most surprising being Bahrain's 1-0 victory over Australia. Qatar suffered a 3-1 loss to the United Arab Emirates, while South Korea and Saudi Arabia were held to draws by lower-ranked teams. The Korean team faced backlash from fans after a goalless draw against Palestine, marking the first game under new coach Hong Myung-bo. Saudi Arabia, despite a home turf advantage, drew 1-1 with Indonesia, with goalkeeper Maarten Paes saving Salem Al-Dawsari's penalty. Elsewhere, Japan demonstrated dominance with a 7-0 victory over China, and Iran secured a 1-0 win against Kyrgyzstan. The path to the 2026 World Cup finals in the US, Mexico, and Canada remains fiercely competitive as teams aim for direct qualification or face additional qualifying rounds. (With inputs from agencies.)

author: 每日经济新闻
title: 凌玮科技：公司目前拥有12项自主研发核心技术，获得32项授权专利，储备80余项专利 _ 东方财富网
text:
每经AI快讯，有投资者在投资者互动平台提问：公司有没有受邀请参加2025纳米材料与器件创新发展大会暨八角湾创新大会？
　　 凌玮科技 （301373.SZ）7月31日在投资者互动平台表示，公司专注于二氧化硅的研发及应用，助力 新材料 性能的提升，为客户提供全面的解决方案。研发是公司长远发展的核心 驱动力 。一直以来，公司高度重视纳米 新材料 产品的创新与研发，我们坚信，唯有具备雄厚研发实力的企业，方能切实解决客户需求，提供更优质的产品质量保障。公司目前拥有12项自主研发核心技术，获得32项授权专利，储备80余项专利。未来，公司将加大研发投入，将自主研发与可持续发展深度融合，赋能下游应用领域的迭代升级，开发更多高附加值、强竞争力的新产品，推动公司核心产品进入更广泛的二氧化硅中高端应用领域，助力主营业务业绩的稳步提升。
（文章来源：每日经济新闻）

author: Via Rowan University Athletics
title: Cannon Becomes All-Time Hits Leader; Struble Goes 4-for-4 as #13 Baseball Defeats Southern Maine, 12-2
text:
Cannon Becomes All-Time Hits Leader; Struble Goes 4-for-4 as #13 Baseball Defeats Southern Maine, 12-2
AUBURNDALE, FL – Tyler Cannon became Rowan’s career leader in hits and Nick Struble went 4-for-4 to pace the #13 Profs’ 12-2 seven-inning win over Southern Maine in the RussMatt Invitational. Rowan (11-1) has now won 10 in a row and has scored double-digit runs in all seven games of the tournament. Cannon, who had been sidelined with an injury for the past four games, returned to the lineup and hit a two-run RBI single into left field in the fifth inning to record his 231st career hit in four years. He breaks the record of 230 previously held by…
Read more at Rowan University Athletics

author: Diario Deportivo Olé
title: Un jugador de Chacarita fue amenazado por su posible pase a Ferro - Olé
text: El mercado se encuentra en su mejor momento. Las altas y bajas están en todos los clubes. Esto desata que haya negociaciones que lleguen a buen puerto y otras que no. Pero cuando los hinchas se pasan de raya, el tema no está bueno. En [Chacarita](https://www.ole.com.ar/tema/chacarita.html?page=3&gad_source=1&gclid=Cj0KCQiA1rSsBhDHARIsANB4EJbIZANKjht4FPdXuvLDAynfmcbiy7p8qOG47UYwevCQLOJfRzAJG94aAq44EALw_wcB), por ejemplo, amenazaron a Ricardo Blanco. Se sabe que los pases a veces terminan en conflictos, con enojos, tanto de los protagonistas como de los hinchas. Pero con Ricky se pasaron. En medio de las charlas para que se sume a [Ferro](https://www.ole.com.ar/tema/ferro.html?gad_source=1&gclid=Cj0KCQiA1rSsBhDHARIsANB4EJbawxLy1Y-2ZasDDNDE2TGTTUCx-dts3WGmCxDnBKPnQVvAa0BtpFoaAh2GEALw_wcB), tuvo que soportar aprietes por las redes. El 10 supo ser uno de los jugadores más importantes de Chaca en este 2023. Sin embargo, en los últimos partidos no estuvo presente por una lesión en su rodilla. Ya cuando las chances de ascender eran nulas (el Funebrero se quedó afuera de la final por el ascenso y después quedó eliminado en la primera fase del Reducido ante Temperley), la salida de Blanco empezó a sonar con más fuerza. Luego de ser apuntado por varios hinchas, algunos se preguntaban por qué se iba a ir. La bomba terminó de explotar cuando Ricky tomó los micrófonos y, fiel a su estilo, dijo: “Hay dirigentes que querían que Chacarita no ascendiera”. Esto lo dejó aún más cerca del adiós. Con el correr de los días, una opción fuerte apareció del club de Caballito. Las amenazas y que dicen desde el club Pero aquí hay versiones encontradas. De un lado dicen que el volante ofensivo está a detalles de ponerse la del Verdolaga. Desde el Tricolor son claros. “Blanco no se va a ningún lado. Tiene contrato con Chacarita hasta diciembre del 2024. Si Ferro o el que sea lo quiere, tiene que poner la plata. Si no, Ricky no se va”, le dijeron a [Olé](https://www.ole.com.ar/) en Villa Maipú. En medio de esto, el jugador habló en redes tras recibir amenazas en contra de su peluquería, la cual está puesta en pleno centro de San Martín. “Lo único que pido es un poco de respeto porque ante todo somos humanos”, escribió, muy dolido por toda esta situación. Parece que esta novela va para rato. Cabe mencionar que la relación del futbolista con Biggeri y con Di Pierro (el presidente de Chacarita) es buena. Y si se queda, el entrenador lo tendrá en cuenta. Se verá.... El paso de Blanco por Chaca Tras vestir las camisetas de Armenio, Defensores de Villa Ramallo, All Boys, Qadsia SC, Instituto, Curicó, Antofagasta, Deportes Iquique, y Rangers de Chile, el volante desembarcó en Chacarita allá por enero del 2022. En el Funebrero jugó un total de 68 encuentros. Anotó 18 goles y dio 16 asistencias. Este último 2023, Blanco fue uno de los jugadores del año en la [Primera Nacional](https://www.ole.com.ar/tema/primera-nacional.html?gad_source=1&gclid=Cj0KCQiA1rSsBhDHARIsANB4EJaXdyHQZqujJnLtCzLM72w43Dw_IZ8fhimXraGDP_hnRbUg572ANjUaAhNFEALw_wcB). La 10 en la espalada y su rendimiento lo hicieron clave en el Chaca de Biggeri. Pero lamentablemente, una lesión en la rodilla, lo dejó fuera de los últimos partidos. Al quedarse Chaca sin ascenso a [Primera](https://www.ole.com.ar/futbol-primera?gad_source=1&gclid=Cj0KCQiA1rSsBhDHARIsANB4EJZZC0_P40HEMiAz7cMFw4avDOJWDDB6HoxKUr1i89vzG23Wc7JbaHUaAkdIEALw_wcB), parte de la gente apuntó contra Ricky, y la relación, con el público se rompió. Lo que fueron dos años de amor e incluso ovaciones, terminaron de la peor manera posible. Con 33 años, el futuro del 10 no está claro.

author: /author/ians/
title: Serbian Parliament approves new govt led by Djuro Macut
text:
Serbian Parliament approves new govt led by Djuro Macut
By IANS | Updated: April 17, 2025 02:47 IST2025-04-17T02:44:03+5:302025-04-17T02:47:04+5:30
Belgrade, April 17 The National Assembly of Serbia has elected a new government led by endocrinologist Djuro Macut. ...
Belgrade, April 17 The National Assembly of Serbia has elected a new government led by endocrinologist Djuro Macut.
A total of 153 members of Parliament voted on Wednesday in favour, 46 opposed, while 51 lawmakers were absent from the session.
The new Cabinet will comprise 31 members, Xinhua news agency reported.
Macut presented his government's programme and cabinet lineup on Tuesday, the first day of the special session of the National Assembly, outlining the key priorities of his administration.
Macut emphasised that his government would focus on domestic stabilisation and strategic foreign policy.
In response to ongoing youth-led protests and institutional disruptions, he pledged to uphold the rule of law and encourage open dialogue while safeguarding the rights of all citizens.
"Protests and expressions of discontent are natural for the youth," Macut said, "but blockades and the denial of others' rights to work, study, or live normally are unacceptable."
He announced the formation of a Council for Youth and Talents, which he will personally oversee.
The council aims to nurture young talent and harness their potential for the country's development.
On international affairs, Macut reaffirmed Serbia's sovereign and balanced approach.
While underscoring Serbia's commitment to the European Union (EU) accession process, he emphasised the country's independence in policymaking.
"Serbia does not approach the EU from a position of pleading, but from one of conviction. This relationship is a partnership founded on mutual respect, not asymmetry," he said.
He also stressed that domestic reforms are guided by national priorities rather than external demands.
"Our reforms are not a response to EU requirements. They are a response to the needs of our citizens," Macut added.
He also reaffirmed Serbia's dedication to broad international cooperation, saying that the country will "extend hands of cooperation to all".
Macut also addressed the Kosovo issue, calling it the highest national priority.
"We do not abandon our principles, but we do not reject dialogue. Peace is impossible without justice," he asserted.
Macut's nomination follows the resignation of former Prime Minister Milos Vucevic, who stepped down on January 28 amid mounting tensions following the deadly canopy collapse at the Novi Sad railway station in November 2024, which resulted in 16 fatalities.
The National Assembly officially confirmed Vucevic's resignation on March 19.
--IANS
Disclaimer: This post has been auto-published from an agency feed without any modifications to the text and has not been reviewed by an editor

author: Jacky
title: Teenager’s body is pulled from frigid waters after four teens – ages 15 to 17 – fell through the ice in Ottawa as another remains missing
text:
The lifeless body of a teenager was recovered from the frigid waters of the Rideau River in Ottawa, Canada, after four friends fell through the ice Wednesday night.
17-year-old Ahmed Haitham was confirmed dead, a 15-year-old girl and a 17-year-old boy were rushed to hospital, and a 16-year-old boy remains missing after hours of overnight search efforts.
The tragedy unfolded when four companions fell through the ice near Nicholls Island Road around 9:30 p.m., approximately 12 miles from downtown Ottawa.
The teens had planned to skate on the river, but the ice had been steadily melting due to warmer-than-average weather, as temperatures rose above freezing over the past week.
Two of the youths were successfully rescued and transported to the Children’s Hospital of Eastern Ontario for treatment for mild hypothermia.
The lifeless body of a teenager was recovered from the frigid waters of the Rideau River in Ottawa, Canada, after four friends fell through the ice Wednesday night.
17-year-old Ahmed Haitham (pictured) was confirmed dead, a 15-year-old girl and a 17-year-old boy were rushed to hospital, and a 16-year-old boy remains missing after hours of overnight search efforts .
The tragedy unfolded when four companions fell through the ice near Nicholls Island Road (pictured) around 9:30 p.m., approximately 12 miles from downtown Ottawa.
The Rideau River flows 91 miles from Upper Rideau Lake in eastern Ontario to the Ottawa River. The body was found near Nicholls Island Road, approximately 12 miles from downtown Ottawa.
Meanwhile, a police diver was sent to hospital for what paramedics described as “a diving-related emergency.”
Ottawa Police said early Thursday morning: “Members of the Ottawa Police Service and emergency crews were called to Nicolls Island Road last night following reports of four youths who had fallen through the ice in the Rideau River.”
The “search for water under very difficult conditions” continued throughout the night, they added. At the time. Two more young men were still missing and were believed to be in the water.
“Police divers later recovered the body of one of the missing youths,” according to authorities.
“The search for the second young man had to be suspended overnight and will begin this morning,” they added.
The Rideau River flows 91 miles from Upper Rideau Lake in eastern Ontario to the Ottawa River.
The famous Rideau Canal, located upstream along the river, is transformed during the winter into the largest skating rink in the world.
The skating season depends on the weather, but typically runs from January to early March. The skating rink is currently closed.
Haitham, the youngest of four siblings in his family, was a month away from turning 18.
The famous Rideau Canal, located upstream along the river, transforms into the world’s largest skating rink during the winter.
The “search for water under very difficult conditions” continued throughout the night, police said. At the time. Two more young men were still missing and were believed to be in the water.
The “search for water under very difficult conditions” continued throughout the night, they added. At the time. Two more young men were still missing and were believed to be in the water.
Haitham, the youngest of the four children in his family, was one month away from turning 18, according to reports
CBC.
The teenager’s father, Haitham Mohammed, and his aunt Faten Ataallah were at the scene waiting to see his body.
The family moved to Canada as refugees from Iraq a decade ago, Ataallah said. “They were excited to start a new beginning.”
Ataallah said Haitham hoped to attend a post-secondary police fundamentals program after graduating from John McRae High School in February of next year.
On Wednesday afternoon, Haitham left the family home to go skating with three friends, but never returned.
“We were all screaming,” Ataallah said. “It’s really hard. We can’t describe it. This is the worst feeling ever.”
Meanwhile, a police diver was sent to hospital for what paramedics described as “a diving-related emergency.”
On Wednesday afternoon, Haitham left the family home to go skating with three friends but never returned.
A GoFundMe page has been set up for Haitham and has raised more than C$8,000 as of Thursday afternoon.
“Ahmed Haitham was a teenager who was graduating in February 2024, aspired to become a police officer and was even being recruited,” the fundraising page reads.
“Just a few nights after a green Christmas, the ice was melting due to warmer weather,” he says.
‘When he got to the river and put on his skates, he only took a few steps on the ice and unfortunately the ice broke.
‘Ahmed and his friends fought for their lives wearing heavy winter pants and jackets, with heavy skates trying to swim in total darkness.
‘Ahmed was an incredible swimmer and could defend himself and save someone too. He in the cold water fighting to save his friends and his own life.
‘Unfortunately, Ahmed and one of his friends did not manage to escape.
“Ahmed’s parents are still in shock and call him by name and ask, ‘Oh Ahmed, where did you go?'” the organizer wrote.
‘As you know, rising costs, high mortgages/rents and food prices are expensive. The family needs your help during this difficult time that all Canadians are going through with our economy.’
